name: Mercure Shrewsbury Albrighton Hall Hotel and Spa

reviews.text: What a fantastic weekend we had during the May Day Bank holiday! We celebrated our parents' Diamond Wedding Anniversary and could not fault the hotel in any way, from checking in to checking out. All of the staff were very curtious and polite and nothing was to much trouble. Food was excellent, especially the steaks. We had a family room which was massive and absolutely spotless. So well done to all the staff and look forward to a return visit.
reviews.title: Great Weekend
Birthday spa treat 12/05/12
reviews.text: My husband treated me to a one night spa break for my birthday. On our arrival they gave us our room early by midday instead of making us wait until 3pm. We had back massages at the spa, these we great and very relaxing. The spa facilities were really good, but it was quite busy by the pool and very noisy. We had bedroom number two, which was beautiful with a very comfortable bed. The curtains were dark so you could sleep well... Apart from the extremely loud banging noise coming from below which was the kitchens! It woke us up at 7am which wasn't planned for our relaxing trip. We did complain to reception and they took £25 off the bill. But the receptionist sounded surprised by our complaint which I have since read about on tripadvisor so they do know about this issue. The staff were very helpful and polite during our stay. The food was great too. Very clean rooms. Would stay again but in a different room.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for one night on a deal with an offers website which meant we got dinner, bed and breakfast for £99. The setting is very nice and the grounds are well kept, although it was raining all the time we were there so we weren't able to enjoy the outdoor areas. Our room was in the extended part of the hotel near to the spa. Room was a decent size and clean but there was no air conditioning and it got really stuffy at night so we had to have the window open, and consequently it wasn't a very comfortable night's sleep and we were woken by the birds singing at 4:30am. The pool was clean and the water nice and warm, although the jacuzzi was a bit small. The extended part of the hotel must be at least 15 years old and is starting to show its age - everything is a bit 1990s. It is desperately in need of a lick of paint and the carpet on the staircase was threadbare in places. The original part of the hotel is really nice and the Oak Room Restaurant is a pleasant place to have a meal. We enjoyed our evening meal and the food was tasty and well presented. We'd chosen our evening meal time when we booked which turned out to be the right decision as when we checked in another couple were having to eat a lot later than they wanted to. Breakfast was a self-service buffet which I always find a bit chaotic and I had to wait a few minutes for more eggs to arrive, but considering it was late in the service it was good to find that the food was still being freshly made. Throughout our stay the staff were really helpful. Overall not much to complain about given the price but I wouldn't stay again mainly because of the issue with temperature control in the room. There is still some way to go if they want to compete with the likes of a Hilton Doubletree and they need to invest in a refresh in the extended part of the hotel. Little touches like having a supply of newspapers in the bar would make a difference.
reviews.title: OK but needs a refresh

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I booked in here for a quick anniversary get away. The hotel and grounds are just as you would expect from a traditional country residence. The food and the service were excellent. The only downside was that we had to queue for some time for breakfast as everyone seemed to want to eat at the same time, it was worth the wait though as the selection and quality were great. Shrewsbury looked as though it would make a worthwhile trip out but unfortunately the weather was so bad we had to abandon it. We would would definitely consider going back another time.
reviews.title: Worth a visit

reviews.text: Me and my partner stayed at this hotel overnight from 5/6/2012 and 6/6/2012. Upon our arrival at the hotel the grounds were beautiful and we were initially impressed. We checked in at Reception and were greeted by a friendly and amicable receptionist. We asked if we could book a table for four people for dinner, and were told that no table would be available until 2030 hours which was too late for us and had to go out for dinner in Shrewsbury town centre. This greatly inconvenienced us as it was supposed to be a relaxing break. When we were handed our room key we checked out the bed and were disappointed to find that the kingsize bed was two single beds pushed together. This left a large ridge in the middle of the bed which was uncomfortable. We then looked in the bathroom and discovered that when taking a shower, the shower head was faulty and sprayed water onto the tiled floor. There was no bathmat to soak up the water and we were forced to use bath towels instead, this is a clear health and safety hazard. The other costly inconvenience we discovered was the price of the wifi which cost £7.00 for 2 hours usage.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel with fine qualities

reviews.text: We then went and used the spa facilities and noticed the pool was unhygenic as it had clumps of hair in it and put us off using it further. The following morning we wanted to make the most of the late check out at 1200 hours and found we couldn't as the cleaner let herself into our room whilst we were in bed at 0915 hours. She was abrupt and quickly turned around and left upon seeing us in bed, slamming the door behind her. A rude awakening we did not want!
reviews.title: Nice hotel

description: 300 year old Shropshire House, a 4 star hotel with 87 en suite rooms, overlooks an ornamental lake in 15 acres of gardens in the heart of Shropshire just 2 miles from the medieval town of Shrewsbury. 30 min from the M6, J10A. Ideal for visiting Chester, Shrewsbury Abbey and the Severn Valley steam railway. Indoor pool, gym, squash courts, sauna, steam room, solarium and beauty treatments. 24 hr room service. Free parking.
